All historical occurrence data from 905 BC to AD 2006 were assigned to grids of 0.5 × 0.5 arc degrees (approximately 50 × 50 km 2, for a total of 3,568 grids in China; the grid number of each species is shown in
SI Appendix, Table S1 ). The year of last observation of a species or groups of species within each grid in our database and the lack of reporting of a grid in the 2014 IUCN distribution map were used to determine the time of local extinction ( Fig. 4). For each grid, the years after the last observation were considered as the years of absence (local extinction); the years of last observation and before the last observation were considered as the years of presence. Years of presence or absence were adjusted to a decadal resolution to match the resolution of the environment variables.
